channel.title: homemade sushi recipe – Ayesha Eats
channel.description: A medical student sharing her whole food adventures! Learn how I incorporate whole grains and whole foods into my diet!

item.title: Vegetarian Sushi
item.dc:creator: Ayesha
item.description:
Now, I know what you’re thinking. Vegetarian sushi is a misnomer. But I promise these are satisfying and use a whole grain (black rice instead of white) to boot! Continue reading "Vegetarian Sushi"
item.content:encoded:
Now, I know what you’re thinking. Vegetarian sushi is a misnomer. But I promise these are satisfying and use a whole grain (black rice instead of white) to boot!

Makes: Enough rice to make 2 rolls. 

Ingredients:

Rice:

½ cup dry black rice

1 cup water

1tbsp rice vinegar

2tsp sugar

1/2tsp salt

Omelette: 

2tsp oil

2 eggs

1/2tsp chili powder

1/2tsp turmeric

Salt to taste

Soy-Tahini Mushroom:

1tsp oil

8oz oyster mushrooms

1tbsp soy sauce

1tbsp tahini

1tbsp maple syrup

1tsp ginger paste

1tsp garlic paste

Other ingredients:

Seaweed 

Avocados

Cucumbers

Instructions:

Rice:

Add rice and water to a small sauce pan. Bring to boil. Then turn down heat, put on a lid and simmer for 30min.

Once the rice is cooked, add the white vinegar, sugar and salt and mix thoroughly. 

Omelette:

Whisk egg and all spices in a separate bowl. Heat a skillet to medium-high heat and add oil. Pour the egg mixture into the pan. Cook for 2min, flip and cook for 1min.

Soy-Tahini Mushrooms:

Heat a skillet to medium-high heat and add oil. Add mushrooms, ginger and garlic and saute for 5min. Add the soy sauce, tahini, maple syrup and saute for 5min.

Assembly:

Lay down a single seaweed sheet, put half of the rice and spread it out. Add any combination of fillings, then delicately roll and cut into 8 pieces per roll.

Serve with soy sauce and wasabi!
